channel.title: Load patch on start up problem
channel.description: Hi, I can't make my patch loading on startup. If in standalone I eject the sdcard and then insert it, the patch loads and works fine. But I want it to be loaded on startup when turning the axoloti on, and not have to eject and insert the card each time. I formated the sdcard with axoloti as suggested on another post regarding this topic, but has not effect. Thanks for your help!

item.title: Load patch on start up problem
item.dc:creator: @Djeremaille
item.description:
@Djeremaille wrote:

It's not my strategy. I don't think I ever used "upload to flash".
My axoloti is booting on the patch I uploaded to SD Card at startup: start.axp then start.bin after compilation.
This one tells axoloti to run another patch on SDCard root:

Pasted image881x497 22.5 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Load patch on start up problem

item.title: Load patch on start up problem
item.dc:creator: @berzelius
item.description:
@berzelius wrote:

Thanks @Djeremaille It works now using your strategy, that is to say "upload to flash" (I forgot to say in my former post I was using "upload to SDCard as startup" option). I think then you need to tell axoloti what patch you need to load on startup in Window->Remote->Running. But this option seems to bug (at least on my OS) and I can't select the patch I want to load on startup. By default It does not load at startup the last patch you uploaded but the first on the list on the SDcard (that's what I understood trying to find a solution). So the solution for me was to delete all the patches I uploaded on the SDcard save the one I want to work with. Now it works fine.
Can somebody explain how to choose the patch to load on startup, I guess it is with the "running" option, would be nice to choose startup patch without having to delete/format SDcard each time.
The option "upload to SDCard as startup"is bug?

Read full topic
item.source: Load patch on start up problem

item.title: Load patch on start up problem
item.dc:creator: @Djeremaille
item.description:
@Djeremaille wrote:

Maybe a SDCard problem.

Look at this post:

Uploading to SD as startup vs internal Flash Software
Hey! I'm having troubles with executing my patch from SD, the Upload to SD as startup option produces a console message returning a success, but the patch doesn't load. This behavior persists after power-cycling the unit with an Android charger instead of the regular USB. Upload to flash seems to do the trick every time, but it seems I have to do a firmware reset before uploading a new patch. If I leave it plugged into the computer via USB, the patch seems to load but my MIDI controller isn't â€¦

Read full topic
item.source: Load patch on start up problem

item.description:
@berzelius wrote:

Hi,
I can't make my patch loading on startup. If in standalone I eject the sdcard and then insert it, the patch loads and works fine. But I want it to be loaded on startup when turning the axoloti on, and not have to eject and insert the card each time. I formated the sdcard with axoloti as suggested on another post regarding this topic, but has not effect. Thanks for your help!
